comments.author: doctordns
comments.body:
PowerShell is, in effect, a great replacement for CMD.EXE in Windows. 

Regarding memory management, Windows does this internally. No need for a 3rd party add-on. You can use PowerShell to retrieve memory counters (either Get-Counter or using WMI)

Finally, the project you refer to is nothing to do with PowerShell.

I suspect this report can be closed.
